products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-watsonx-orchestrate
products.label: Cloud automation for watsonx Orchestrate
products.short_description: Creates and configures an instance of IBM watsonx Orchestrate.
products.long_description: IBM watsonx Orchestrate puts AI to work—helping you build, deploy and manage powerful AI assistants and agents that automate workflows and processes with generative AI. This deployable architecture creates and configures an instance of IBM watsonx Orchestrate. For detailed information on IBM watsonx Orchestrate, please refer this [documentation](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/current?topic=getting-started-watsonx-orchestrate).

features.title: watsonx Orchestrate instance
features.description: Provision and configure an instance of IBM watsonx Orchestrate. Explore more about IBM watsonx Orchestrate [here](https://www.ibm.com/products/watsonx-orchestrate).

products.support_details: This product is in the community registry, as such support is handled through the originated repository. If you experience issues please open an issue in the repository [here](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-watsonx-orchestrate/issues). Please note this product is not supported via the IBM Cloud Support Center.

features.title: watsonx Orchestrate instance
features.description: This architecture creates and configures an instance of IBM watsonx Orchestrate.

diagrams.description: This solution provisions a `watsonx Orchestrate` instance on IBM Cloud. Once the instance is successfully created, you will receive a dashboard link that provides direct access to your watsonx Orchestrate environment. Optionally, you may also configure IBM Cloud Observability resources—such as logging, monitoring, and activity tracker event routing—to enhance visibility and operational insights.

configuration.description: When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance will be configured to collect platform metrics from the provided region. You can configure 1 instance only of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance has already been configured. You may not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).
